Police: New York gunman set 'trap' for firefighters

An ex-con who served time for his grandma's death lured firefighters to his home by setting a fire early today, police said. Two firefighters were killed. (AP)

From the shadows, a
dream and a book emerge

The publication of the children’s book “Rhoda’s Ocean” was the moving epilogue to a romance between two artists that lasted more than 60 years.

Patriots QB Tom Brady’s postgame diatribe after Sunday's sloppy win was a plea to his teammates not to squander a great opportunity, to play with more urgency.

More local school districts have expressed interest in the ALICE fast-response program following the shooting rampage in Connecticut.

New cancer therapy uses gold

Cancer drugs would be carried into the body on tiny gold particles under a therapy being developed by the Waltham oncology unit of AstraZeneca­ and a Maryland company.
Opinion | John E. Sununu

A Senate built on trust

Senators Daniel Inouye and Warren Rudman shared a friendship that was the type of bond that used to be quite common among US senators.

Turning to animals for ideas

Animal life is a big source of inspiration for Dr. Jeffrey Karp and his colleagues at the center on regenerative therapeutics at Brigham and Women’s Hospital.
